content: In the old pre-template days, there was a control file where I could specify the name of the output directory. WIth templates, that appears to be gone? I need to have my output be in a different directory name and rather than rename the directory after the fact, I'd love the publisher just to put stuff there. Is that possible?
did you try adding the path-output parameter in your IG ?
i don't know if the template overrides it (i think it doesn't)
no, because I didn't think of looking at that page.
works perfectly. thanks again @Jose Costa Teixeira
basically I use /docs for github pages and /output for the autobuild.
Be aware that the CI build won't work if the output is anywhere other than 'output'.
I.e. it won't host the site on build.fhir.org and could potentially blow up

also note for github pages there may be a markdown file or two that sneek into the outputed folder that will cause github pages issues. - I am not sure if this issue has been fixed or not as it only shows up occasionally for me.
If the markdown pages are put in the right folders, they shouldn't propagate...
